intro: Wahlenbergia tumida, commonly known as the Bluebell of the Southern Alps, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, sky-blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in harsh conditions. Wahlenbergia tumida is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often found in wildflower gardens and conservation areas.
